metadata.Title: CVE-2023-43622 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
An attacker, opening a HTTP/2 connection with an initial window size of 0,was able to block handling of that connection indefinitely in Apache HTTPServer. This could be used to exhaust worker resources in the server,similar to the well known "slow loris" attack pattern. This has been fixedin version 2.4.58, so that such connection are terminated properly afterthe configured connection timeout. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server:from 2.4.55 through 2.4.57. Users are recommended to upgrade to version2.4.58, which fixes the issue.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-43622` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.14
apache2-bin - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.14
apache2-data - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.14
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.14
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.14
apache2-utils - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.14
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.14
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-4ubuntu3.14').
